abstract: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll finds that a large majority of Republican primary voters have yet to make up their minds about the candidate they would like to see as their party's nominee for president in 2012.
snippet: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll finds that a large majority of Republican primary voters have yet to make up their minds about the candidate they would like to see as their party's nominee for president in 2012.
lead_paragraph: With the nation's first nominating contests just two months away, a large majority of Republican primary voters have yet to make up their minds about the candidate they would like to see as their party's nominee for president in 2012.

headline.main: Most Republican Primary Voters Remain Uncommitted
